result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher W Crewz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher W Crewz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher W Crewz was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bail Applied.  Paid In Full.  The remaining bail to be refunded to poster.

TIME SERVED.
Jail.
Credit For Time Served 15 Days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher W Crewz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christopher W Crewz in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Konrad Paczuski and Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Fragoso states that he believed the defendant would plead to DC and the remaining counts would be dismissed.  State notes in there file it is noted that the remaining counts would be dismissed and read in. 
Court takes recess for charging DA to speak with defense.  Case reconvenes at 10:46.
Plea Colloquy.
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 3,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 1 and 2 are dismissed.

15 days Jail (Credit - 15 days)  TIME SERVED

Costs:  $343.00  BAIL TO APPLY.  Remaining to be refunded to poster.
